alert.note: Alert for Coffey; Lyon; Osage; Shawnee; Wabaunsee (Kansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued February 26 at 11:43PM CST by NWS Topeka
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of southwestern Shawnee, southeastern Wabaunsee, Osage, northwestern Coffey and eastern Lyon Counties through 1215 AM CST... At 1143 PM CST, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Eskridge to 4 miles east of Admire to near Hartford. Movement was northeast at 55 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Southwestern Topeka, Osage City, Carbondale, Eskridge, Dover, Auburn, Lyndon, Lebo, Burlingame, Scranton, Melvern, Hartford, Neosho Rapids, Harveyville, Reading, Olivet, Pauline, Melvern Lake and Beto Junction. This includes the following highways... Interstate 35 between mile markers 138 and 155. Interstate 70 between mile markers 350 and 355. Kansas Turnpike between mile markers 143 and 176. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 100 AM CST for east central Kansas.
